instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.CPUIMVP_VR_ON: What is CPUIMVP_VR_ON? CPUIMVP_VR_ON is a signal that tells the buck converter responsible for PPVCORE_S0_CPU to turn on and create CPU vcore voltage. This comes from ALL_SYS_PWRGD â€“ once ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present, CPUIMVP_VR_ON will be present. .
definitions.P5VS3_PGOOD: What is P5VS3_PGOOD? P5VS3_PGOOD indicates that the PP5V_S3 power rail is functioning properly..
definitions.P1V5S0_PGOOD: What is P1V5S0_PGOOD? P1V5S0_PGOOD is a signal that asserts itself when the PP1V5_S0 power rail turns on and works .

threads.title: [SOLVED] Not turn power on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (pgood missing from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>)
threads.message:
Hello everyone

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B board.have greenlight at magsafe ,charging battery, when plug charge machine not turning on ( fans not working ,not chime etc) but GPU is hot up. When i checked voltage cant get <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> so cant get CPUVCORE.

Can you help me?

threads.title: [SOLVED] Not turn power on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (pgood missing from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>)
threads.message: What is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>? a bad mosfet on GPU buck converter could be pulling down <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and also making the GPU hot. Orange light doesn't mean it is charging the battery if <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is too low! My guess is your <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 1.7v due to bad high side MOSFET on GPU buck converter.

threads.title: [SOLVED] Not turn power on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (pgood missing from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>)
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is seems ok 12.5V. Yes orange light mean is charging battery ( when i connected battery its turning orange)  GPU is not too fast hot when i plug magsafe in one minute its warming up. <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> ,<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> is ok. I cant understand:(

threads.title: [SOLVED] Not turn power on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (pgood missing from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>)
threads.message: One of the S0 or S3 voltages is missing. Check which bus is not coming high, my bet is on 1V8 bus.

threads.title: [SOLVED] Not turn power on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (pgood missing from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>)
threads.message:
I checked S0 and S3 voltage its ok.But chipset vcore voltage is missing ( only <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_CPU_VCCPQE</SIGNAL> have)
They comes from <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> when i checked it i cant see <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_VR_ON</SIGNAL> and shematics show  <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> ==<RESISTOR>R7974</RESISTOR>==<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_VR_ON</SIGNAL>. But I dont have <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>. My brain is really confused:(  Any body can help me

threads.title: [SOLVED] Not turn power on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (pgood missing from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>)
threads.message:
I checked S0 and S3 voltage its ok.But chipset vcore voltage is missing ( only <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_CPU_VCCPQE</SIGNAL> have)
They comes from <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> when i checked it i cant see <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_VR_ON</SIGNAL> and shematics show <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> ==<RESISTOR>R7974</RESISTOR>==<SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_VR_ON</SIGNAL>. But I dont have <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>. My brain is really confused[IMG]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/core/images/smilies/frown.png[/IMG] Any body can help me

threads.title: [SOLVED] Not turn power on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (pgood missing from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>)
threads.message: Again, <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is not there because you are missing one of the S3 or S0 voltages.    [SIZE=12px][FONT=Courier]<SIGNAL>P1V5S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>P1V8S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>P5VS3_PGOOD</SIGNAL>, CPUVCCIOS0_PGOOD, PCHVCCIOS0_PGOOD, <SIGNAL>PVCCSA_PGOOD</SIGNAL>. One of these voltages will be missing, check them. Look at the diagram how <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is generated and try to understand the circuit.[/FONT][/SIZE]

threads.title: [SOLVED] Not turn power on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (pgood missing from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>)
threads.message:
Thank you for answer dukefawks.
I checked again S3 and S0 voltages. I see peoblem at pgood returns. For example <SIGNAL>P1V8S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL> is not present but i can measure L7720 1.8V and same thing is <SIGNAL>P5VS3_PGOOD</SIGNAL> not present but L7220 shows 5V. When i inject 3.3V at <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> fan starts to spin ( SMC reads that i think) but no VCORE.

threads.title: [SOLVED] Not turn power on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (pgood missing from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>)
threads.message: If any of the PCGOOD signals is missing none of them will be there, they are all connected together. Check all the coils for voltage, CPUcore voltages do not matter at this time.

threads.title: [SOLVED] Not turn power on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B (pgood missing from <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>)
threads.message:
Problem solved after when i replaced <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>. Sorry dukefawks you are right board dont have PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG_R so its cant create PGOOD signals.

Thank you.
